snippet: For the first time in more than half a century, the average American is both earning less and worth less than four years earlier, when figures are adjusted for inflation.
abstract: Floyd Norris Off the Charts Column analyzes Federal Reserve report that found the average American is both earning less and worth less than in 2008; notes that drop-off can be largely attributed to the decline in the value of homes.
lead_paragraph: For the first time in more than half a century, the average American is both earning less and worth less than four years earlier, when figures are adjusted for inflation.

headline.print_headline: Income and Wealth Are Down in U.S.
